Ms. Blakeley and Ms. Greenberg, who will change their surnames to Silver, are Web site designers and developers, and each owns Internet consulting businesses in Brooklyn.

Ms. Blakeley, 32, graduated with an associate degree in advertising design from the Phoenix Art Center in Arizona, which was owned by the National Education Center. She is the daughter of Teresa Galban of Alamogordo, N.M., and D. Ray Blakeley of Clayton, N.M. Her father retired as a reporter with The Union County Leader, a weekly newspaper in Clayton. Her mother retired as a sixth-grade teacher at Oregon Elementary School in Alamogordo. She is also the stepdaughter of Ralph Galban, who retired as a bilingual education teacher for fifth and sixth grades at Sacramento Elementary School in Alamogordo.

Ms. Greenberg, 30, graduated cum laude from Columbia. She is a daughter of Susan E. Hodge and David A. Greenberg of Teaneck, N.J. Her parents are both professors at Columbia University Medical Center. Her father is the director of the division of statistical genetics at the Mailman School of Public Health and studies the genetics of common diseases. He is also a research scientist with the New York State Psychiatric Institute at the medical center. Her mother is a mathematician who works on the statistical methodology used in genetics research at the State Psychiatric Institute and the School of Public Health.
